original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /

analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /

analyzed: glang po'i rgyal po ltar shin tu dul ba /

original: zag pa zad pa /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa /

original: nyon mongs pa med pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa /
translated: They were free from afflictions.

original: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /

original: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba /
translated: Their insight was completely liberated.

original: bya ba byas pa /
analyzed: bya ba byas pa /

original: khur bor ba /
analyzed: khur bor ba /
translated: They had cast off their burdens.

original: bdag gi don rjes su thob pa /
analyzed: bdag gi don rjes su thob pa /
translated: They had attained their own goals.

original: srid @216a *// par sbyor ba yongs su bcad pa /
analyzed: srid @216a *// par sbyor ba yongs su bcad pa /

original: dbang phyug dam pa'i mchog thob pa /
analyzed: dbang phyug dam pa'i mchog thob pa /

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la rab tu gnas pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la rab tu gnas pa /

analyzed: thabs dang / shes rab kyis yongs su bkod pa /

original: pha rol gyi mthar phyin par gyur pa la /
analyzed: pha rol gyi mthar phyin par gyur pa la /
translated: They had reached the other shore.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They were:

original: tshe dang ldan pa steng rgyas 'od srung dang / tshe dang ldan pa ga y'a 'od srung dang / tshe dang ldan pa chu bo 'od srung dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po dang /

analyzed: dga' bo dang / 'di dag la sogs pa nyan thos chen po rnams phyi dro'i dus kyi tshe /
translated: and Nanda and others, these great śrāvakas, in the afternoon,

analyzed: so so nas nang du yang dag par 'jog pa las langs te /
translated: each rose from their solitary meditation,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag btsal te /
translated: went to where the Blessed One was, bowed their heads at the Blessed One’s feet,🔽and sat to one side.

original: lan gsum bskor ba byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: lan gsum bskor ba byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: They circumambulated him three times and then sat to one side.

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bye ba brgya stong dang yang thabs gcig ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bye ba brgya stong dang yang thabs gcig ste /
translated: He was also accompanied by a hundred thousand million bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: de dag kyang klu'i rgyal po ltar dpal dang / gzi brjid chen por ldan pas kun tu grags pa /
analyzed: de dag kyang klu'i rgyal po ltar dpal dang / gzi brjid chen por ldan pas kun tu grags pa /
translated: They were renowned for their great splendor and majesty, like the king of the nāgas.

original: sbyin pa dang / tshul @216b khrims rnam par dag pa rtag tu srung bar mos pa dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus bskal pa grangs med par spyad pa /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul @216b khrims rnam par dag pa rtag tu srung bar mos pa dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus bskal pa grangs med par spyad pa /
translated: They were dedicated to always maintaining pure generosity and discipline, and they had practiced patience and diligence for countless eons.

original: bsam gtan kun las 'das pa'i dran pa mngon du gyur pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan kun las 'das pa'i dran pa mngon du gyur pa /
translated: They had actualized the mindfulness that transcends all meditative concentrations.

original: shes rab kyi sgo rnam par phye ba /
analyzed: shes rab kyi sgo rnam par phye ba /
translated: They had opened the door to insight.

original: thabs mkhas pa shin tu bsgrubs pa /🔽dbang dam pas rnam par rol cing mngon par shes pa dam pa brnyes pa /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa shin tu bsgrubs pa / dbang dam pas rnam par rol cing mngon par shes pa dam pa brnyes pa /
translated: They had accomplished skillful means.🔽They had attained the highest mastery and had achieved the highest superknowledges.

original: gzungs chen po thob pa; spobs pa mi zad pa /
analyzed: gzungs chen po thob pa; spobs pa mi zad pa /
translated: They had attained the great dhāraṇīs and inexhaustible eloquence.

original: nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas myur du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob cing bdud dang / phyir rgol ba'i dpung 'joms pa /

translated: They quickly attain the wisdom of omniscience by abandoning all afflictions and all thoroughly afflicted phenomena and they destroy the armies of Māra and opponents.

analyzed: chos kyi rnga chen po rdung bas mu stegs can thams cad 'dul zhing sems rnam par dang ba bskyed par byed pa /
translated: They tame all tīrthikas by beating the great drum of the Dharma and they cause the generation of a pure mind.

analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas lha dang mi rnams sgrol bar byed pa /

analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad brgyan par byed pa /

original: 'gro ba drug na gnas pa rnams la phan dam pa 'dogs pa /
analyzed: 'gro ba drug na gnas pa rnams la phan dam pa 'dogs pa /
translated: They bring the highest benefit to those who dwell in the six existences.

original: ye shes chen po phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: ye shes chen po phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: They are endowed with the perfection of great wisdom.

original: bzod pa chen po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: bzod pa chen po dang ldan pa /
translated: They possess great patience.

original: byams pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: byams pa dang ldan pa /

original: snying rje chen po'i sems la gnas pa /
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i sems la gnas pa /
translated: They abide in the mind of great compassion.

original: mthu chen po brtan pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: mthu chen po brtan pa dang ldan pa /

original: sangs rgyas thams cad la bsnyen bkur byas pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad la bsnyen bkur byas pa /

original: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' zhing ma 'ongs pa'i mtha' klas pas gnas par yi dam chen po 'chang ba /🔽sangs rgyas mang po @217a *//

original: la rgyu rnam par dag pa bskyed pa /
analyzed: la rgyu rnam par dag pa bskyed pa /
translated: They had generated the pure causes for many buddhas.

original: dus gsum gyi chos mi skye bar bzod pa thob pa /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi chos mi skye bar bzod pa thob pa /
translated: They had attained the acceptance that phenomena are unborn in the three times.🔽They had transcended the domain of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis spyod yul las shin tu 'das pa; thabs mkhas pa chen pos 'jig rten 'dren pa sten pa chen pos bstan pa'i chos zab mo dgongs pa 'grel ba la mkhas pa /

analyzed: stong pa nyid mngon du gyur pas the tshom yongs su chad par gyur pa la /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They were:

original: tshor ba la nan tan byed pa'i dbang gis sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshor ba la nan tan byed pa'i dbang gis sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Due to their intent on sensations, they experience various forms of suffering.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni bdag gir 'dzin pa yongs su bcad cing tshor ba mi mnga' bas mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba dang / 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad ni bgrang zhing dpag tu yod la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni bdag gir 'dzin pa yongs su bcad cing tshor ba mi mnga' bas mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba dang / 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad ni bgrang zhing dpag tu yod la /
translated: All conditioned phenomena can be counted and measured,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos ni bgrang zhing dpag pa thams cad dang bral ba @233a *//
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos ni bgrang zhing dpag pa thams cad dang bral ba @233a *//
translated: but unconditioned phenomena are free from all counting and measuring.

original: ste sangs rgyas kyis 'dus byas kyi chos spangs shing 'dus ma byas kyi chos mngon du mdzad de /
analyzed: ste sangs rgyas kyis 'dus byas kyi chos spangs shing 'dus ma byas kyi chos mngon du mdzad de /
translated: The Buddha has abandoned conditioned phenomena and actualized unconditioned phenomena,🔽so he is free from counting and measuring. Therefore, he is called “nirvāṇa.”🔽The Thus-Gone One sees that the nature of sentient beings and phenomena is completely empty,

original: bgrang ba dang / dpag pa mi mnga' bas de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pas sems can dang / chos kyi rang bzhin kun stong pa dang / stong pa de las gzhan pa'ang yod pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: bgrang ba dang / dpag pa mi mnga' bas de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pas sems can dang / chos kyi rang bzhin kun stong pa dang / stong pa de las gzhan pa'ang yod pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: and that apart from that emptiness, there is nothing else.

original: stong pa'i rang bzhin de nyid yang dag pa'i chos kyi sku yin pas de'i phyir de la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: stong pa'i rang bzhin de nyid yang dag pa'i chos kyi sku yin pas de'i phyir de la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The nature of emptiness is the true dharmakāya, and therefore it is called “nirvāṇa.”

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: chos bcu po de dag gis ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos bcu po de dag gis ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: these ten are called nirvāṇa.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Moreover, son of noble family,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las mi 'da' ba de 'ba' zhig ngo mtshar che ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las mi 'da' ba de 'ba' zhig ngo mtshar che ba ma yin gyi /
translated: it is not only the non-passing into nirvāṇa of the Tathāgatas that is so amazing.

original: gzhan yang ngo mtshar du bya ba'i chos rnam pa bcu yod pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang ngo mtshar du bya ba'i chos rnam pa bcu yod pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod pa'o //
translated: There are ten other amazing qualities that are the conduct of the Tathāgatas.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'khor ba ni skyon dang ldan pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi zhing dben pa yin na 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa de gnyis mnyam par mkhyen pas 'khor ba la'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: 'khor ba ni skyon dang ldan pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi zhing dben pa yin na 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa de gnyis mnyam par mkhyen pas 'khor ba la'ang mi gnas /
translated: Although saṃsāra is flawed and nirvāṇa is peaceful and secluded, the Tathāgatas know that saṃsāra and nirvāṇa are the same. Therefore, they do not remain in saṃsāra,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la'ang mi bzhugs shing gang sems can rnams kyi don la mi skyo ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la'ang mi bzhugs shing gang sems can rnams kyi don la mi skyo ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod pa'o //
translated: nor do they remain in nirvāṇa. And they are never discouraged about the welfare of sentient beings. This is the conduct of the Tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas byis pa so so'i skye bo phyin ci log tu spyod pa dang / nyon mongs @233b ba sna tshogs kyis glags par gzigs kyang 'di dag rnam par grol bar bya'o snyam du mi dgongs mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas byis pa so so'i skye bo phyin ci log tu spyod pa dang / nyon mongs @233b ba sna tshogs kyis glags par gzigs kyang 'di dag rnam par grol bar bya'o snyam du mi dgongs mod kyi /
translated: The Tathāgata sees that childish ordinary beings are engaged in error and are afflicted by various afflictions, but he does not think, “I will liberate them.”

original: sngon gyi thugs rje dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i mthus sems can 'di dag so so'i dbang po dang / rang bzhin dang / bsam pa ci la mos pa rtog pa mi mnga' bar lhun gyis grub pa'i tshul gyis phyi ma'i mthar thug pa med par phan 'dogs shing ston pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi thugs rje dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i mthus sems can 'di dag so so'i dbang po dang / rang bzhin dang / bsam pa ci la mos pa rtog pa mi mnga' bar lhun gyis grub pa'i tshul gyis phyi ma'i mthar thug pa med par phan 'dogs shing ston pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod pa'o //
translated: However, by the power of his previous compassion and roots of virtue, he spontaneously and effortlessly benefits and teaches these sentient beings, according to their individual faculties, natures, and aspirations, until the end of saṃsāra. That is the activity of the Tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sems can rnams la gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis rgyas par bstan pas phan gdags so snyam du mi dgongs mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sems can rnams la gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis rgyas par bstan pas phan gdags so snyam du mi dgongs mod kyi /
translated: The Tathāgata does not think, “I will benefit by extensively teaching the twelve branches of scripture to sentient beings.”

original: sngon gyi thugs rje dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i mthus sems can 'di dag la phyi ma'i mthar thug pa med par chos rgyas par ston pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi thugs rje dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i mthus sems can 'di dag la phyi ma'i mthar thug pa med par chos rgyas par ston pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod pa'o //
translated: By the power of their previous compassion and roots of virtue, they teach the Dharma extensively to sentient beings without limit. This is the activity of the Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong 'dab tu gshegs shing rgyal po dang / blon po dang / bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs la sogs pa'i khyim du bsod snyoms blang ngo snyam du mi dgongs mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong 'dab tu gshegs shing rgyal po dang / blon po dang / bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs la sogs pa'i khyim du bsod snyoms blang ngo snyam du mi dgongs mod kyi /
translated: The Tathagatas do not think, “I will go to the villages, towns, and cities and receive alms in the houses of kings, ministers, Brahmins, nobles, and commoners.”

original: sngon gyi sku dang / gsung dang / thugs kyi spyod pa la goms pa'i mthus lhun gyis grub par bsod snyoms la gshegs shing phan pa'i don mdzad pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi sku dang / gsung dang / thugs kyi spyod pa la goms pa'i mthus lhun gyis grub par bsod snyoms la gshegs shing phan pa'i don mdzad pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod pa'o //
translated: However, by the power of their previous practice of body, speech, and mind, they spontaneously go for alms and benefit others. This is the activity of the Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la sbrebs pa dang / skyems pa'ang @234a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la sbrebs pa dang / skyems pa'ang @234a *//
translated: The body of the Tathagata is free from hunger and thirst,

original: mi mnga'/ bshang gci dang / sku nyam chung ba'ang mi mnga' bar bsod snyoms len par snang yang de la gsol ba'ang med /
analyzed: mi mnga'/ bshang gci dang / sku nyam chung ba'ang mi mnga' bar bsod snyoms len par snang yang de la gsol ba'ang med /
translated: He does not have a body that is subject to defecation or urination, nor does he have a body that is weak. He appears to receive alms, but he does not need to eat.

original: de'i rnam par rtog pa'ang mi mnga' mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i rnam par rtog pa'ang mi mnga' mod kyi /
translated: He does not have any thoughts.

original: sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir bsod snyoms gsol bar yang snang ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa lhun gyis grub pa'o //
analyzed: sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir bsod snyoms gsol bar yang snang ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa lhun gyis grub pa'o //
translated: He appears to receive alms in order to benefit sentient beings. This is the Tathāgata’s spontaneously accomplished conduct.

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pas sems can 'di dag gi dbang po rab dang / 'bring dang / tha ma ji lta ba bzhin du chos bstan to snyam du mi dgongs mod kyi /
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pas sems can 'di dag gi dbang po rab dang / 'bring dang / tha ma ji lta ba bzhin du chos bstan to snyam du mi dgongs mod kyi /
translated: “The Tathāgata does not think, ‘I will teach the Dharma to these sentient beings according to their superior, middling, and inferior faculties.’

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis so so'i dbang po dang / snod ji lta ba yin pa rtog pa mi mnga' ba rab tu mkhyen cing de dag la chos ston pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis so so'i dbang po dang / snod ji lta ba yin pa rtog pa mi mnga' ba rab tu mkhyen cing de dag la chos ston pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod pa'o //
translated: The Blessed Buddha, without any thought, knows the individual faculties and vessels as they are, and teaches the Dharma to them. This is the conduct of the Tathāgatas.🔽“

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sems can 'di dag ni gus pa med pa rtag tu tshig rtsub pos ngan du smra ba yin pas 'di dag dang lhan cig mi smra'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sems can 'di dag ni gus pa med pa rtag tu tshig rtsub pos ngan du smra ba yin pas 'di dag dang lhan cig mi smra'o //
translated: The Tathagata does not think, “These sentient beings are disrespectful and always speak harshly and badly of me, so I will not speak to them.

original: sems can 'di dag ni nga la rtag tu gus par byed pa bstod cing snyan par smra ba yin pas 'di dag dang lhan cig smra bar bya'o zhes de bzhin gshegs pa mi dgongs te /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni nga la rtag tu gus par byed pa bstod cing snyan par smra ba yin pas 'di dag dang lhan cig smra bar bya'o zhes de bzhin gshegs pa mi dgongs te /
translated: These sentient beings are always respectful to me, praise me, and speak nicely to me, so I will speak to them.”

original: byams pa dang / thugs rjes mnyam par dgongs shing gnyis su med pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa dang / thugs rjes mnyam par dgongs shing gnyis su med pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod pa'o //
translated: The Tathagata does not think like that. He thinks equally with love and compassion, without duality. That is the conduct of the Tathagatas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la byams sdang dang / nga rgyal dang / 'dod pa dang / @234b ser sna la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa mi mnga' mod kyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la byams sdang dang / nga rgyal dang / 'dod pa dang / @234b ser sna la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa mi mnga' mod kyi /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, do not have afflictions such as love, hatred, pride, desire, and stinginess.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag par dben pa la dgyes shing 'du 'dzi thams cad spangs te 'dod pa chung ba la bsngags pa mdzad pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag par dben pa la dgyes shing 'du 'dzi thams cad spangs te 'dod pa chung ba la bsngags pa mdzad pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod pa'o //
translated: The Tathagatas are always pleased with solitude, and they praise the abandonment of all distractions and the practice of few desires.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos 'ga' tsam yang mi mkhyen pa 'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos 'ga' tsam yang mi mkhyen pa 'am /
translated: The Tathagatas do not have any ignorance,🔽nor do they have any lack of knowledge.

original: thugs su ma chud pa mi mnga' ba dang / gnas thams cad du me long lta bu'i ye shes mngon du gyur pas rnam par mi rtog mod kyi /
analyzed: thugs su ma chud pa mi mnga' ba dang / gnas thams cad du me long lta bu'i ye shes mngon du gyur pas rnam par mi rtog mod kyi /
translated: They are not non-conceptual, because the mirror-like wisdom is manifest in all situations.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sems can 'di dag gi las dang / spyod pa la gzigs nas de dag gi bsam pa dang mthun par sbyor bas thabs kyis 'dren cing 'khor ba las sgrol ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sems can 'di dag gi las dang / spyod pa la gzigs nas de dag gi bsam pa dang mthun par sbyor bas thabs kyis 'dren cing 'khor ba las sgrol ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod pa'o //
translated: The Tathagatas observe the actions and conduct of these sentient beings, and they lead them with skillful means in accordance with their aspirations, liberating them from cyclic existence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sems can gang dag phyug cing dar ba gzigs na'ang dgyes pa mi skye /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sems can gang dag phyug cing dar ba gzigs na'ang dgyes pa mi skye /
translated: The Tathagatas do not feel joy when they see sentient beings who are wealthy and prosperous,🔽nor do they feel sorrow when they see sentient beings who are poor and destitute.

original: rgud pa dang / dma' ba gzigs na'ang thugs ngan mi mdzad mod kyi /
analyzed: rgud pa dang / dma' ba gzigs na'ang thugs ngan mi mdzad mod kyi /
translated: Even if he sees that they are in decline or in a low state, he does not become distressed.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sems can de dag yang dag pa'i spyod pa sgrub pa gzigs nas thogs pa med pa'i thugs rje chen pos skyob bar mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sems can de dag yang dag pa'i spyod pa sgrub pa gzigs nas thogs pa med pa'i thugs rje chen pos skyob bar mdzad do //
translated: The Tathagata, seeing that those sentient beings are practicing the right conduct, protects them with his great unobstructed compassion.

original: sems can la la log par spyod pa gzigs na'ang chags pa med pa'i thugs rje chen pos skyob cing 'dzin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sems can la la log par spyod pa gzigs na'ang chags pa med pa'i thugs rje chen pos skyob cing 'dzin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod pa'o //
translated: If he sees that some sentient beings are practicing wrongly, he protects and holds them with his great compassion that is free of attachment. This is the conduct of the Tathagatas.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams @235a *//
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams @235a *//
translated: this is the right conduct of the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones.

original: kyi yang dag pa'i spyod pa mtha' med par bstan pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid du shes par gyis shig /
analyzed: kyi yang dag pa'i spyod pa mtha' med par bstan pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid du shes par gyis shig /
translated: You should understand that it is the characteristic of the truth of nirvana.

original: skabs gzhan dag tu mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / ring bsrel 'jig rten du bzhag ces bya ba de ni thabs mkhas pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: skabs gzhan dag tu mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / ring bsrel 'jig rten du bzhag ces bya ba de ni thabs mkhas pa bstan pa ste /
translated: In other contexts, the statement that the Tathāgata enters nirvana and that his relics are placed in the world is a demonstration of skillful means.

original: sems can rnams kyis mchod pa dang / rim gro byed pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i mthu yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis mchod pa dang / rim gro byed pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i mthu yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Those offerings and services to the Tathāgata should be seen as the power of his compassion and the power of the roots of virtue of those sentient beings.

original: de la gang zhig mchod pa dang / rim gro byed pa de ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na mi khom pa brgyad yongs su spangs te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang phrad cing dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang ldan pa dang / byang chub kyi sems mi gtong ba dang /
analyzed: de la gang zhig mchod pa dang / rim gro byed pa de ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na mi khom pa brgyad yongs su spangs te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang phrad cing dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang ldan pa dang / byang chub kyi sems mi gtong ba dang /
translated: Those who make offerings and render service will in the future abandon the eight unfavorable conditions and encounter the Tathāgatas, will have spiritual benefactors, and will not abandon the thought of awakening.

original: bsod nams dpag tu med pa 'phel ba dang / 'khor ba las myur du 'da' zhing 'khor ba'i 'ching bas glags par mi 'gyur ba'i spyod pa dam pa 'di yin pas khyod kyis nan tan du bsgrub cing g-yel ba med par bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dpag tu med pa 'phel ba dang / 'khor ba las myur du 'da' zhing 'khor ba'i 'ching bas glags par mi 'gyur ba'i spyod pa dam pa 'di yin pas khyod kyis nan tan du bsgrub cing g-yel ba med par bya'o //
translated: This is the holy conduct that increases immeasurable merit, quickly transcends saṃsāra, and does not fall under the bondage of saṃsāra. Therefore, you should practice it earnestly and without distraction.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' mdzes pa'i tog gis bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i don dang / bzod pa zab mo bstan pa bcom ldan 'das la mngon du thos nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' mdzes pa'i tog gis bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i don dang / bzod pa zab mo bstan pa bcom ldan 'das la mngon du thos nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Beautiful Crest, having directly heard from the Blessed One the meaning of not passing into nirvāṇa and the teaching of profound patience, bowed with palms joined and made this request:

original: deng gzod bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa ston pa chen po mya ngan las mi @235b 'da' ba dang / ring bsrel 'jig rten du bzhug cing sems can rnams la phan pa rgya cher mdzad pa 'di 'tshal bar gyur nas lus dang / sems dga' zhing rangs pa ngo mtshar du gyur to; ;de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku tshe'i tshad 'di bstan pa na grangs med dpag tu med cing mtha' yas pa'i sems can de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so
analyzed: deng gzod bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa ston pa chen po mya ngan las mi @235b 'da' ba dang / ring bsrel 'jig rten du bzhug cing sems can rnams la phan pa rgya cher mdzad pa 'di 'tshal bar gyur nas lus dang / sems dga' zhing rangs pa ngo mtshar du gyur to; ;de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku tshe'i tshad 'di bstan pa na grangs med dpag tu med cing mtha' yas pa'i sems can de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so
translated: When this lifespan of the Thus-Gone One was taught, all those countless, limitless, and infinite beings gave rise to the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: // de bzhin gshegs pa de dag kyang mi snang bar gyur nas byang chub sems dpa' mdzes pa'i tog kyang stan las langs nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag btsal te slar yang rang gi gnas de nyid du 'dug go /
analyzed: // de bzhin gshegs pa de dag kyang mi snang bar gyur nas byang chub sems dpa' mdzes pa'i tog kyang stan las langs nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag btsal te slar yang rang gi gnas de nyid du 'dug go /
translated: The thus-gone ones then disappeared, and the bodhisattva Beautiful Crest also rose from his seat, bowed to the feet of the Blessed One, and returned to his own abode.

original: gser 'od dam pa mdo sde'i dbang po'i rgyal po las /
analyzed: gser 'od dam pa mdo sde'i dbang po'i rgyal po las /
translated: From the King of Glorious Sutras, the Sublime Golden Light,🔽this is chapter two:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku tshe'i tshad bstan pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste gnyis pa'o ////
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku tshe'i tshad bstan pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste gnyis pa'o ////
translated: The Teaching on the Lifespan of the Tathagata.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i snying po 'khor 'dus pa de'i nang nas stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te thal mo sbyar nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i snying po 'khor 'dus pa de'i nang nas stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te thal mo sbyar nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs
translated: Then, from within that assembly, the bodhisattva mahasattva Akashagarbha rose from his seat, draped his upper robe over one shoulder, placed his right knee on the ground, joined his palms,🔽bowed to the feet of the Blessed One,

original: la phyag btsal te gser dang / rin po che'i me tog dang / rin po che'i rgyal mtshan dang / gdugs dam pas mchod pa byas nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: la phyag btsal te gser dang / rin po che'i me tog dang / rin po che'i rgyal mtshan dang / gdugs dam pas mchod pa byas nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and made offerings of gold, precious flowers, precious victory banners, and excellent parasols. Then he said to the Blessed One:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin @236a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin @236a *//
translated: Blessed One, I wish to ask a question of the bodhisattva mahasattva Ajita, the great being, about the bodhisattvas' conduct.

original: gshegs pa rnams kyi dgongs pa shin tu zab pa de tshul bzhin ji ltar bsgrub par bgyi zhes gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gshegs pa rnams kyi dgongs pa shin tu zab pa de tshul bzhin ji ltar bsgrub par bgyi zhes gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rigs kyi bu /
translated: The Bhagavat replied, Son of good family,🔽listen well and keep it in mind!

original: legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zungs shig dang / khyod la de'i don rnam par phye ste bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zungs shig dang / khyod la de'i don rnam par phye ste bstan par bya'o //
translated: I will explain it to you.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la sku rnam pa gsum mnga' ste /
translated: all Tathagatas have three kinds of bodies.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: sprul pa'i sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The emanation body, the enjoyment body, and the Dharma body.

original: 'di lta bu'i sku gsum lhun gyis grub pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dzin te /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i sku gsum lhun gyis grub pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dzin te /

analyzed: gang gis de mngon du gyur pa rnams 'khor ba las 'byung bar byed do //
translated: Those who realize this will emerge from saṃsāra.

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpas sprul pa'i sku shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpas sprul pa'i sku shes par bya zhe na /
translated: Among them, how should bodhisattvas understand the emanation body?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family,

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa sngon sa rnam par sbyong ba'i dus na skye bo thams cad kyi phyir chos rnam pa sna tshogs sgrub bo //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa sngon sa rnam par sbyong ba'i dus na skye bo thams cad kyi phyir chos rnam pa sna tshogs sgrub bo //
translated: That is the Tathāgata, when in the past he was purifying the stages, accomplishing various kinds of dharmas for the sake of all beings.

analyzed: de ltar spyod pa sbyangs pas rnal 'byor gyi mthar phyin pa yin no //
translated: Thus, through purifying his conduct, he perfected yoga.

original: rnal 'byor de'i stobs kyis dbang chen po thob bo //
analyzed: rnal 'byor de'i stobs kyis dbang chen po thob bo //
translated: By the power of that yoga, he attained the great empowerment.

original: dbang chen po'i mthus skye bo'i bsam pa ji lta ba dang / spyod pa ji lta ba dang / khams ji lta ba bzhin du thams cad mngon du gyur nas dus la mi gzhes /
analyzed: dbang chen po'i mthus skye bo'i bsam pa ji lta ba dang / spyod pa ji lta ba dang / khams ji lta ba bzhin du thams cad mngon du gyur nas dus la mi gzhes /
translated: By the power of the great empowerment, he actualized everything according to the thoughts, conduct, and dispositions of beings, without transgressing the time,

original: dus la mi 'da'/
analyzed: dus la mi 'da'/
translated: without missing the time,

original: gnas dang mthun pa /
analyzed: gnas dang mthun pa /
translated: in accord with the place,

original: dus dang @236b mthun pa /
analyzed: dus dang @236b mthun pa /
translated: in accord with the time,

original: spyod pa dang mthun pa /
analyzed: spyod pa dang mthun pa /
translated: in accord with the conduct,

original: chos bshad pa dang yang mthun par sku rnam pa sna tshogs ston pa de ni sprul pa'i sku zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos bshad pa dang yang mthun par sku rnam pa sna tshogs ston pa de ni sprul pa'i sku zhes bya'o //
translated: and in accord with the Dharma teaching. He displayed various bodies. That is called the emanation body.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku shes par bya zhe na /
translated: how should bodhisattvas understand the enjoyment body?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la thogs pa med par thob par bya ba'i phyir don dam pa'i bden pa ston te 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ro gcig pa nyid du shes par bya ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la thogs pa med par thob par bya ba'i phyir don dam pa'i bden pa ston te 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ro gcig pa nyid du shes par bya ba dang /
translated: They teach so that they may understand the sameness of saṃsāra and nirvāṇa,🔽so that they may delight beings who are frightened by the elimination of the view of the transitory collection,

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba bsal nas sems can 'jigs par gyur pa rnams dga' bar bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mtha' yas pa'i rgyur gyur pas bden pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes dang mthun par sngon gyi smon lam gyi mthus sku de ston par 'gyur te mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba bsal nas sems can 'jigs par gyur pa rnams dga' bar bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mtha' yas pa'i rgyur gyur pas bden pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes dang mthun par sngon gyi smon lam gyi mthus sku de ston par 'gyur te mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang /
translated: so that they may be the cause of the infinite qualities of the buddhas, and so that they may teach that body through the power of their previous aspirations in accordance with the truth, suchness, and the wisdom of suchness.🔽It is adorned with the thirty-two major marks

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa /🔽'od sku la 'khor ba grub pa de ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku zhes bya'o; ;rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa /🔽'od sku la 'khor ba grub pa de ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku zhes bya'o; ;rigs kyi bu /
translated: and the eighty minor marks.🔽Son of noble family,

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos kyi sku shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos kyi sku shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How should the bodhisattva mahāsattva know the dharma body?

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba /
translated: It is free from all afflictive obstructions,

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad rdzogs pa'i phyir de kho na nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes nyid tsam du gnas pa de ni chos kyi sku zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad rdzogs pa'i phyir de kho na nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes nyid tsam du gnas pa de ni chos kyi sku zhes bya'o //
translated: and because all virtuous dharmas are complete, it abides as just the suchness and the authentic wisdom itself. That is called the dharma body.

original: sku snga ma de gnyis ni btags pa tsam mo //
analyzed: sku snga ma de gnyis ni btags pa tsam mo //
translated: Those two previous bodies are mere imputations.

original: @237a *// chos kyi sku ni mang dag pa ste sku de gnyis kyi gzhi byed do //
analyzed: @237a *// chos kyi sku ni mang dag pa ste sku de gnyis kyi gzhi byed do //
translated: The dharma body is the manifold, serving as the basis for those two bodies.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos kyi sku de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes las gud na sangs rgyas kyi chos gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sku de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes las gud na sangs rgyas kyi chos gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because apart from the suchness of the dharma body and nonconceptual wisdom, there are no other buddha dharmas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: The tathāgatas are endowed with perfect wisdom.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i mthar phyin pa ste; sangs rgyas kyi sa rnam par dag pa brnyes pa'i phyir chos kyi de kho na nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i mthar phyin pa ste; sangs rgyas kyi sa rnam par dag pa brnyes pa'i phyir chos kyi de kho na nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: He has reached the end of the abandonment of all afflictions, and because he has attained the pure stage of Buddhahood, he upholds the qualities of the Buddha through the reality of the Dharma and true wisdom.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Moreover, son of noble family,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ni bdag dang / gzhan gyi don gyi mthar phyin pa ste de la chos kyi de bzhin nyid kyis ni bdag gi don mdzad /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ni bdag dang / gzhan gyi don gyi mthar phyin pa ste de la chos kyi de bzhin nyid kyis ni bdag gi don mdzad /
translated: all Buddhas have reached the end of benefiting themselves and others. In this regard, through the suchness of phenomena, they accomplish their own benefit,

original: de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes kyis ni gzhan gyi don mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes kyis ni gzhan gyi don mdzad do //
translated: and through the wisdom of suchness, they accomplish the benefit of others.

original: bdag dang / gzhan la phan pa'i don mdzad pa la dbang brnyes pa'i phyir mdzad  pa mtha' yas pa sna tshogs lhun gyis grub bo //
analyzed: bdag dang / gzhan la phan pa'i don mdzad pa la dbang brnyes pa'i phyir mdzad  pa mtha' yas pa sna tshogs lhun gyis grub bo //
translated: Because they have attained mastery in accomplishing the benefit of self and others, they spontaneously accomplish the infinite variety of deeds.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos dpag tu med pa mtha' yas pa rnam pa mang po khyad par du bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos dpag tu med pa mtha' yas pa rnam pa mang po khyad par du bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the immeasurable, infinite, and manifold qualities of all Buddhas are distinctively taught.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: dper na / rnam par rtog pa'i sems la brten nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa mang po dang / las rnam pa mang po dang / 'bras bu rnam pa mang po ston pa de bzhin du chos kyi chos nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes @237b la brten nas /
analyzed: dper na / rnam par rtog pa'i sems la brten nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa mang po dang / las rnam pa mang po dang / 'bras bu rnam pa mang po ston pa de bzhin du chos kyi chos nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes @237b la brten nas /
translated: For example, based on the mind that is conceptual, many kinds of afflictions, many kinds of actions, and many kinds of results are shown. In the same way, based on the dharmatā of phenomena and the wisdom of thusness,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam pa sna tshogs dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam pa sna tshogs dang / nyan thos kyi chos rnam pa sna tshogs mang po ston to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam pa sna tshogs dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam pa sna tshogs dang / nyan thos kyi chos rnam pa sna tshogs mang po ston to //
translated: many kinds of buddhadharmas, many kinds of pratyekabuddhadharmas, and many kinds of śrāvakadharmas are shown.

original: chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes la brten nas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos la dbang phun sum tshogs pa brnyes pa de ni dam pa dpag par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes la brten nas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos la dbang phun sum tshogs pa brnyes pa de ni dam pa dpag par dka' ba yin no //
translated: Based on the suchness of phenomena and the wisdom of thusness, the attainment of the perfect mastery of all the dharmas of the buddhas is difficult to fathom.

original: dper na / nam mkha' la ri mo bris te rgyan du byas pa de ni dpag par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha' la ri mo bris te rgyan du byas pa de ni dpag par dka' ba yin no //
translated: For example, it is difficult to fathom a painting in the sky that is used as an ornament.

original: de bzhin du yang dag pa'i chos dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes la brten nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bsgrub pa'ang dpag par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag pa'i chos dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes la brten nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bsgrub pa'ang dpag par dka' ba yin no //
translated: Likewise, it is difficult to fathom the accomplishment of the qualities of the Buddha in dependence on the correct Dharma and the correct pristine wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: ji ltar na chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar na chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' zhing /
translated: how is it that the suchness of phenomena and the pristine wisdom of suchness are free from conceptualization,

original: phrin las la mnga' brnyes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: phrin las la mnga' brnyes pa yin zhe na /
translated: and how do they attain mastery over activity?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das kyang smon lam la mnga' brnyes pas phrin las kyi rnam pa thams cad kyang mdzad de de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes kyis don thams cad grub par mnga' mdzad pa'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das kyang smon lam la mnga' brnyes pas phrin las kyi rnam pa thams cad kyang mdzad de de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes kyis don thams cad grub par mnga' mdzad pa'ang de bzhin no //
translated: for example, even after the Tathāgata has passed into nirvāṇa, all the aspects of activity are performed through the mastery of aspiration, and the accomplishment of all aims through suchness and the pristine wisdom of suchness is also like that.

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ting nge 'dzin du snyoms par zhugs pa las sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis bsam gtan de las bzhengs te don dang / phrin las thams cad mdzad @238a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ting nge 'dzin du snyoms par zhugs pa las sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis bsam gtan de las bzhengs te don dang / phrin las thams cad mdzad @238a *//
translated: just as a bodhisattva mahāsattva, having entered into samādhi, arises from that samādhi through the power of previous aspirations and performs all benefits and activities,

original: pa ltar chos rnam pa gnyis kyang rnam par rtog pa med par don thams cad mdzad pa la mnga' brnyes pa'o //
analyzed: pa ltar chos rnam pa gnyis kyang rnam par rtog pa med par don thams cad mdzad pa la mnga' brnyes pa'o //
translated: in the same way, the two kinds of dharmas are also mastered in performing all benefits without conceptualization.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: dper na / nyi ma dang / zla ba la'ang rnam par rtog pa med /
analyzed: dper na / nyi ma dang / zla ba la'ang rnam par rtog pa med /
translated: for example, the sun and moon have no conceptualization.

original: chu dang / me long la'ang rnam par rtog pa med /
analyzed: chu dang / me long la'ang rnam par rtog pa med /
translated: Water and mirrors also have no conceptualization.

original: snang ba la'ang rnam par rtog pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: snang ba la'ang rnam par rtog pa med mod kyi /
translated: Light also has no conceptualization.

original: gsum 'dus pa las gzugs brnyan 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa las gzugs brnyan 'byung ngo //
translated: However, from the coming together of the three, a reflection arises.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes la'ang rnam pa rtog pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes la'ang rnam pa rtog pa med mod kyi /
translated: In the same way, although the suchness of phenomena and the wisdom of suchness have no conceptualization,

original: smon lam gyi dbang gis sems can skal ba can dag la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i sku'ang nyi zla'i gzugs brnyan bzhin rgyu dang / rkyen 'dus pa la byung ngo //
analyzed: smon lam gyi dbang gis sems can skal ba can dag la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i sku'ang nyi zla'i gzugs brnyan bzhin rgyu dang / rkyen 'dus pa la byung ngo //
translated: By the power of his vows, the sambhogakāya appears to fortunate sentient beings, and the nirmāṇakāya appears to sentient beings, like the reflection of the sun and moon, arising from the convergence of causes and conditions.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang / dper na /
analyzed: gzhan yang / dper na /
translated: it is also like this:

original: tshad med grangs med pa'i chu dang / me long dag ni snang ba la brten nas stong pa'i gzugs brnyan mtshan nyid tha dad pa dag snang ngo //
analyzed: tshad med grangs med pa'i chu dang / me long dag ni snang ba la brten nas stong pa'i gzugs brnyan mtshan nyid tha dad pa dag snang ngo //
translated: in countless, immeasurable amounts of water and mirrors, empty reflections appear, based on light, with different characteristics.

original: stong pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: What is called “empty” is without characteristics.

original: rigs kyi bu; de bzhin du longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i sku ni 'khor rnams la chos kyi sku'i gzugs brnyan ston par smon lam gyi dbang gis sku de gnyis snang ste mtshan sna tshogs su snang na'ang chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu; de bzhin du longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i sku ni 'khor rnams la chos kyi sku'i gzugs brnyan ston par smon lam gyi dbang gis sku de gnyis snang ste mtshan sna tshogs su snang na'ang chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa med do //
translated: Son of noble family, in the same way, the sambhogakāya and the nirmāṇakāya appear to the retinue, displaying the reflection of the dharmakāya. By the power of their vows, those two kāyas appear, appearing with various characteristics, but the characteristics of the dharmakāya are not different.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: sku de gnyis la gnas te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams phung @238b po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes gsung ngo //
analyzed: sku de gnyis la gnas te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams phung @238b po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes gsung ngo //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are said to abide in the nirvāṇa that is not a place, because they abide in those two bodies.

original: chos kyi sku las dgongs te phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos kyi sku las dgongs te phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: But they are said to abide in the nirvāṇa that is a place, because they abide in the Dharma Body.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na; der ni chos thams cad zad pa'i mthar gyur pa'i phyir sku 'di gsum la brten nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na; der ni chos thams cad zad pa'i mthar gyur pa'i phyir sku 'di gsum la brten nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa zhes bshad do //
translated: For it is on the basis of these three bodies that the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are said to abide in the nirvāṇa that is not a place, because there the end of the extinction of all things is reached.

original: sku gnyis po ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes mi gsung ste chos kyi sku las gzhan pa'i sangs rgyas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku gnyis po ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes mi gsung ste chos kyi sku las gzhan pa'i sangs rgyas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the other two bodies are not said to be nirvāṇa, because there is no Buddha apart from the Dharma Body.

original: ci'i phyir sku gnyis po la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sku gnyis po la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes mi bya zhe na /
translated: Why are the other two bodies not called nirvāṇa?

original: sku de gnyis ni yang dag pa ma yin pa btags pa tsam pas skad cig tu skye zhing 'gag pa rtag par mi gnas pa dang / yang dang yang du 'byung bas ma nges pa ltar chos kyi sku ni de lta ma yin no //🔽bam po gnyis pa ////
analyzed: sku de gnyis ni yang dag pa ma yin pa btags pa tsam pas skad cig tu skye zhing 'gag pa rtag par mi gnas pa dang / yang dang yang du 'byung bas ma nges pa ltar chos kyi sku ni de lta ma yin no // bam po gnyis pa ////
translated: Since these two bodies are not real, but merely imputed, they arise and cease moment by moment, and do not endure permanently. Since they occur again and again, they are not definite. The Dharma Body is not like that.

original: de'i phyir sku de gnyis ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sku de gnyis ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, these two bodies are not called nirvana.

original: chos kyi sku'ang de dang mi gnyis pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa ma yin bas sku de gsum las brten te mi gnas pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa zhes gsung ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'ang de dang mi gnyis pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa ma yin bas sku de gsum las brten te mi gnas pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa zhes gsung ngo //
translated: Since the Dharma Body is not different from them, it does not abide in nirvana. Because it does not abide in any of these three bodies, it is called nirvana.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: de la byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni mtshan nyid gsum gyi phyir 'ching pa dang / sgrib pa yod pas sku gsum las ring du gyur to //
analyzed: de la byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni mtshan nyid gsum gyi phyir 'ching pa dang / sgrib pa yod pas sku gsum las ring du gyur to //
translated: Here, ordinary foolish people, because of the three characteristics, are bound and obscured, and are far from the three bodies.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi @239a *//
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi @239a *//
translated: The imagined characteristic, the dependent characteristic, and the perfected characteristic.

original: dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of empowerment, and the characteristic of complete accomplishment.

original: mtshan nyid de rnams shes pa dang / 'gog pa dang / dag par ma gyur pa de'i phyir sku gsum ma thob bo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de rnams shes pa dang / 'gog pa dang / dag par ma gyur pa de'i phyir sku gsum ma thob bo //
translated: Because they do not know these characteristics, do not stop them, and do not purify them, they do not attain the three bodies.

original: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid gsum shes pa dang / 'gog pa dang / rnam par byang bar gyur pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sku gsum yongs su rdzogs par gyur to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid gsum shes pa dang / 'gog pa dang / rnam par byang bar gyur pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sku gsum yongs su rdzogs par gyur to //
translated: Because they know these three characteristics, stop them, and purify them, the bhagavān buddhas completely accomplish the three bodies.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis rnam par shes pa gsum ma spangs pa'i phyir sku gsum las ring du gyur to //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis rnam par shes pa gsum ma spangs pa'i phyir sku gsum las ring du gyur to //
translated: Because ordinary foolish beings do not abandon the three consciousnesses, they are far from the three bodies.

original: gsum gang zhe na; dngos po la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / kun gzhi la gnas pa'i yid dang / kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na; dngos po la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / kun gzhi la gnas pa'i yid dang / kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: What are the three? The consciousness that engages with things, the mind that abides in the all-base, and the consciousness of the all-base.

original: lam sbyong ba dag la gnas pas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa sbyong ngo //
analyzed: lam sbyong ba dag la gnas pas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa sbyong ngo //
translated: Those who abide in the training on the path purify the engaging consciousness.

original: gcod pa'i lam la gnas pas kun gzhi la gnas pa'i yid sbyong ngo //
analyzed: gcod pa'i lam la gnas pas kun gzhi la gnas pa'i yid sbyong ngo //
translated: By abiding in the path of cutting, the mind that abides in the all-ground is purified.

original: mchog tu rgyal ba'i lam la gnas pas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa sbyangs so //
analyzed: mchog tu rgyal ba'i lam la gnas pas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa sbyangs so //
translated: By abiding in the path of supreme victory, the all-ground consciousness is purified.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa sbyangs na sprul pa'i sku mngon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa sbyangs na sprul pa'i sku mngon du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the engaging consciousness is purified, the nirmāṇakāya will manifest.

original: kun gzhi la gnas pa'i yid sbyangs pas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ston to //
analyzed: kun gzhi la gnas pa'i yid sbyangs pas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ston to //
translated: By purifying the mind that abides in the all-ground, the saṃbhogakāya is revealed.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa sbyangs pas ni chos kyi sku 'thob ste de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad sku gsum lhun gyis grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa sbyangs pas ni chos kyi sku 'thob ste de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad sku gsum lhun gyis grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: By purifying the all-ground consciousness, the dharmakāya is attained. Thus, it is called the ‘spontaneously present three kāyas of all tathāgatas.’

original: @239b rigs kyi bu /🔽sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sprul pa'i sku ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang spyod pa mthun pa'o //🔽longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang dgongs ba mthun pa'o //
analyzed: @239b rigs kyi bu / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sprul pa'i sku ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang spyod pa mthun pa'o // longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang dgongs ba mthun pa'o //
translated: Son of the family!🔽The nirmāṇakāya of all buddhas is in accord with the conduct of all buddhas.🔽The saṃbhogakāya is in accord with the intention of all buddhas.

original: chos kyi sku ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang sku mthun pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang sku mthun pa'o //
translated: The dharmakāya is in accord with the kāya of all buddhas.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sku ni so so'i skye bo'i yid dang mthun par rnam pa mang pos mtshan ma sna tshogs ston pa'i phyir mang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sku ni so so'i skye bo'i yid dang mthun par rnam pa mang pos mtshan ma sna tshogs ston pa'i phyir mang po zhes bya'o //
translated: The emanation body of the Buddha is called “many” because it displays various signs in many ways in accordance with the minds of ordinary beings.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni 'khor rnams kyi bsam pa gcig pas mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir mtshan nyid gcig ces bya'o //🔽chos kyi sku ni mtshan ma sna tshogs las yang dag par 'das pa mtshan mar bzung ba'i spyod yul ma yin pa ste de bas na gcig pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni 'khor rnams kyi bsam pa gcig pas mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir mtshan nyid gcig ces bya'o // chos kyi sku ni mtshan ma sna tshogs las yang dag par 'das pa mtshan mar bzung ba'i spyod yul ma yin pa ste de bas na gcig pa'ang ma yin /
translated: The enjoyment body is called “of one characteristic” because the retinue has a single intention and a single characteristic.

original: tha dad pa'ang ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa'ang ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The Dharma body is said to be “neither one nor different” because it is utterly beyond various signs and is not an object to be grasped as a sign.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: sprul pa'i sku ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la brten te mngon par snang ngo //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la brten te mngon par snang ngo //
translated: The emanation body manifests in dependence on the enjoyment body.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni chos kyi sku la brten te mngon par snang ngo //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni chos kyi sku la brten te mngon par snang ngo //
translated: The enjoyment body manifests in dependence on the Dharma body.

original: chos kyi sku ni yang dag pa ste ci la'ang mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni yang dag pa ste ci la'ang mi gnas pa'o //
translated: The Dharma body is real and does not abide anywhere.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: sku de gsum ni rtag par bshad pa'i rnam grangs kyang yod /
analyzed: sku de gsum ni rtag par bshad pa'i rnam grangs kyang yod /
translated: There are also synonyms for these three bodies that are explained as permanent.

original: mi rtag par bshad pa'i rnam grangs kyang yod do //🔽sprul pa'i sku ni thabs mkhas pas gnas thams cad du dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du rgyun mi 'chad par chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i @240a *//
analyzed: mi rtag par bshad pa'i rnam grangs kyang yod do // sprul pa'i sku ni thabs mkhas pas gnas thams cad du dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du rgyun mi 'chad par chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i @240a *//
translated: There are also synonyms that are explained as impermanent.

original: phyir rtag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyir rtag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The emanation body is called permanent because it is the skillful means that turns the wheel of the Dharma in all realms without interruption, in accordance with the focus.

original: de gzhir ma gyur pas mdzad pa chen po phun sum tshogs pa mngon du mi ston pa'i phyir mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gzhir ma gyur pas mdzad pa chen po phun sum tshogs pa mngon du mi ston pa'i phyir mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called impermanent because it does not manifest the perfection of great deeds without being the basis.🔽The enjoyment body is called permanent because it is uninterrupted from beginningless time and it holds and gathers the unshared qualities of all buddhas.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas rgyun mi 'chad cing sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos ma 'dres pas yongs su 'dzin cing sdud pa'i phyir sems can zad pa med pas spyod pa'ang mi zad de de'i phyir rtag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas rgyun mi 'chad cing sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos ma 'dres pas yongs su 'dzin cing sdud pa'i phyir sems can zad pa med pas spyod pa'ang mi zad de de'i phyir rtag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since sentient beings are inexhaustible, its enjoyment is also inexhaustible.

original: de'ang gzhir ma gyur pa'i phyir mdzad pa chen po phun sum tshogs pa mngon du mi ston par mi rtag pa zhes bya'o; ;chos kyi sku ni 'du byed kyi chos ma yin pa mtshan ma tha dad pa med pa rtsa ba dang / gzhir gyur pa'i phyir nam mkha' ji lta ba bzhin pas de ni rtag pa zhes bya'o; ;rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: de'ang gzhir ma gyur pa'i phyir mdzad pa chen po phun sum tshogs pa mngon du mi ston par mi rtag pa zhes bya'o; ;chos kyi sku ni 'du byed kyi chos ma yin pa mtshan ma tha dad pa med pa rtsa ba dang / gzhir gyur pa'i phyir nam mkha' ji lta ba bzhin pas de ni rtag pa zhes bya'o; ;rigs kyi bu /
translated: The Dharma body is not a conditioned phenomenon, and it is not a different sign. Because it is like space, it is called permanent.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes las gud na 'phags pa'i ye shes med do //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes las gud na 'phags pa'i ye shes med do //
translated: Son of good family, apart from nonconceptual wisdom there is no noble wisdom.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi chos nyid las kyang lhag pa'i spyod yul med do; ;de ni chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ye shes kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid de gnyis kyi de bzhin nyid ni gcig pa'ang ma yin tha dad pa'ang ma yin pas de'i phyir chos kyi sku ni ye shes rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi chos nyid las kyang lhag pa'i spyod yul med do; ;de ni chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ye shes kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid de gnyis kyi de bzhin nyid ni gcig pa'ang ma yin tha dad pa'ang ma yin pas de'i phyir chos kyi sku ni ye shes rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: Apart from the reality of suchness there is no superior object. That is the suchness of the Dharma, the suchness of wisdom, and the suchness of those two suchnesses. Since they are neither the same nor different, the Dharma body is the pure wisdom.

original: spangs pa rnam par dag pa gnyis kyi phyir chos kyi sku ni rnam par dag pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spangs pa rnam par dag pa gnyis kyi phyir chos kyi sku ni rnam par dag pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: For the sake of the twofold purity of abandonment, the Dharma Body is said to be endowed with the perfection of purity.

original: rigs @240b kyi bu; gzhan yang /
analyzed: rigs @240b kyi bu; gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover, son of noble family,

original: sku 'di gsum dbye ba la'ang rnam pa bzhi ste /🔽sprul pa'i sku yin la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ma yin pa'ang yod /
analyzed: sku 'di gsum dbye ba la'ang rnam pa bzhi ste / sprul pa'i sku yin la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ma yin pa'ang yod /
translated: these three bodies are also of four kinds in terms of their differentiation.🔽There is the emanation body that is not the enjoyment body,

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin la sprul pa'i sku ma yin pa'ang yod /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin la sprul pa'i sku ma yin pa'ang yod /
translated: there is the enjoyment body that is not the emanation body,

original: sprul pa'i sku yin la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin pa'ang yod //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku yin la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin pa'ang yod //
translated: there is that which is both the emanation body and the enjoyment body,

original: sprul pa'i sku'ang ma yin la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'ang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku'ang ma yin la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'ang ma yin pa'o //
translated: and there is that which is neither the emanation body nor the enjoyment body.

original: sprul pa'i sku yin la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku yin la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the emanation body that is not the enjoyment body?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mya ngan las 'das su zin kyang smon lam gyi dbang gis skal pa ji lta ba bzhin phan 'dogs pa ni sprul pa'i sku zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mya ngan las 'das su zin kyang smon lam gyi dbang gis skal pa ji lta ba bzhin phan 'dogs pa ni sprul pa'i sku zhes bya'o //
translated: Even after the Tathāgatas have passed into nirvāṇa, they benefit according to the fortune [of beings] through the power of their aspirations. This is called the emanation body.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin la sprul pa'i sku ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin la sprul pa'i sku ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the enjoyment body but not the emanation body?

original: sa'i snga rol pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: sa'i snga rol pa'i sku'o //
translated: It is the body prior to the stage.

original: sprul pa'i sku'ang yin la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'ang yin pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku'ang yin la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'ang yin pa de gang zhe na /
translated: What is the emanation body as well as the enjoyment body?

original: lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i sku'o //
translated: It is the body of nirvāṇa with remainder.

original: sprul pa'i sku'ang ma yin la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'ang ma yin pa de ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku'ang ma yin la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'ang ma yin pa de ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: What is neither the emanation body nor the enjoyment body? It is the Dharma body.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: chos kyi sku de ni chos gnyis su med pa mngon du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku de ni chos gnyis su med pa mngon du gyur pa'o //
translated: the Dharma body is the manifestation of the nonduality of phenomena.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /🔽chos kyi sku de la mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gnyi ga med pa ste yod pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na / chos kyi sku de la mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gnyi ga med pa ste yod pa'ang ma yin /
translated: What is duality?

original: med pa'ang ma yin /🔽gcig pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: med pa'ang ma yin / gcig pa'ang ma yin /
translated: In the Dharma body, neither characteristics nor the basis of characteristics exist, nor do they not exist.

original: tha dad pa'ang ma yin /🔽bgrang ba'ang ma @241a *//
analyzed: tha dad pa'ang ma yin / bgrang ba'ang ma @241a *//
translated: They are neither one nor different.

original: yin; bgrang bar mi bya ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: yin; bgrang bar mi bya ba'ang ma yin /
translated: They are neither counted nor not counted.

original: snang ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: snang ba'ang ma yin /
translated: They are neither apparent nor not apparent.

original: mun pa'ang ma yin pa ste de lta bu'i de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes la mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhir yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: mun pa'ang ma yin pa ste de lta bu'i de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes la mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhir yang mi dmigs /
translated: In such a wisdom of suchness, characteristics and the basis of characteristics are not observed.

original: yod pa dang / med par yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: yod pa dang / med par yang mi dmigs /
translated: It is not observed as existent or nonexistent.

original: gcig pa dang tha dad par yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: gcig pa dang tha dad par yang mi dmigs /
translated: It is not observed as one or different.

original: bgrang bar yang mi dmigs bgrang bar mi bya bar yang mi dmigs //
analyzed: bgrang bar yang mi dmigs bgrang bar mi bya bar yang mi dmigs //
translated: It is not observed as countable or uncountable.🔽It is not observed as light or dark.

original: snang ba dang / mun par yang mi dmigs pa ste 'di ltar spyod yul rnam par dag pa dang / ye shes rnam par dag pa de dbyer med pa; bar mtshams med pa /
analyzed: snang ba dang / mun par yang mi dmigs pa ste 'di ltar spyod yul rnam par dag pa dang / ye shes rnam par dag pa de dbyer med pa; bar mtshams med pa /
translated: Thus, the pure domain and the pure wisdom are inseparable, without interruption,

original: 'gog pa dang lam gyi gzhir gyur pa ste de'i phyir na chos kyi sku de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa sna tshogs mngon du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam gyi gzhir gyur pa ste de'i phyir na chos kyi sku de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa sna tshogs mngon du gyur pa'o //
translated: and are the basis of the path and cessation. Therefore, that dharmakāya is the manifestation of the various activities of the Tathāgata.

original: rigs kyi bu; sku 'di ni rgyu dang / rkyen dang / spyod yul dang / gnas dang / 'bras bu dag gzhi nyid la brten pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste don de mngon par shes na sku de nyid theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu; sku 'di ni rgyu dang / rkyen dang / spyod yul dang / gnas dang / 'bras bu dag gzhi nyid la brten pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste don de mngon par shes na sku de nyid theg pa chen po'o //
translated: Son of good family, this body is based on causes, conditions, fields, abodes, and fruits, and is inconceivable. If one understands this meaning, then this body is the Great Vehicle.

original: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: It is the essence of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ste sku de la brten nas sems dang po bskyed pa dang / sa yongs su sbyong ba'i sems mngon par 'byung ste sa las phyir mi ldog pa'i sems kyang mngon du 'gyur ba dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa la gnas pa'i sems dang @241b rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ste sku de la brten nas sems dang po bskyed pa dang / sa yongs su sbyong ba'i sems mngon par 'byung ste sa las phyir mi ldog pa'i sems kyang mngon du 'gyur ba dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa la gnas pa'i sems dang @241b rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: Based on this body, the mind that first generates the thought of enlightenment and the mind that purifies the stages manifest, and the mind that does not turn back from the stages becomes manifest. The mind that is impeded by a single birth and the vajra-like samādhi manifest.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa'ang mngon par 'byung /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa'ang mngon par 'byung /
translated: The intention of the Tathāgata also manifests.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam pa'i chos tshad med grangs med pa thams cad kyang mngon du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam pa'i chos tshad med grangs med pa thams cad kyang mngon du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All the immeasurable and innumerable true dharmas of the Tathāgata also manifest.

original: chos kyi sku la brten nas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin chen po'ang mngon du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sku la brten nas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin chen po'ang mngon du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Based on the Dharma body, the great samādhi that is inconceivable also manifests.

original: chos kyi sku 'di la brten nas ye shes chen po thams cad kyang snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sku 'di la brten nas ye shes chen po thams cad kyang snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Based on this Dharma body, all great wisdoms also appear.

original: de lta bas na sku gnyis ni ting nge 'dzin dang / ye shes la brten nas 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na sku gnyis ni ting nge 'dzin dang / ye shes la brten nas 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the two bodies arise based on samādhi and wisdom.

original: chos kyi sku 'di ni rang gi ngo bo nyid la brten nas rtag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku 'di ni rang gi ngo bo nyid la brten nas rtag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This Dharma body is called “permanent” based on its own essence.

original: bdag ces bya'o //
analyzed: bdag ces bya'o //
translated: It is called “self.”

original: ting nge 'dzin chen po la brten pas na bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin chen po la brten pas na bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Based on great samādhi, it is called “bliss.”

original: ye shes chen po la brten pas na rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rtag par bde ba dang / rnam par dag pa la mnga' brnyes shing bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes chen po la brten pas na rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rtag par bde ba dang / rnam par dag pa la mnga' brnyes shing bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Based on great wisdom, it is called “purity.” Therefore, the Tathāgata abides having attained permanence, bliss, and purity.

original: ting nge 'dzin chen po la brten nas dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa thams cad dang / byams pa chen po dang /🔽snying rje chen po dang / gzungs thams cad dang / mngon par shes pa thams cad dang / dbang thams cad dang / mnyam pa nyid @242a *//
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin chen po la brten nas dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa thams cad dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / gzungs thams cad dang / mngon par shes pa thams cad dang / dbang thams cad dang / mnyam pa nyid @242a *//
translated: Based on the great meditative absorption, all meditative absorptions such as the meditative absorption of the heroic stride, all applications of mindfulness such as the application of mindfulness to the teachings, great loving kindness,

original: kyi chos thams cad 'dzin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kyi chos thams cad 'dzin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon par 'byung ngo //
translated: great compassion, all powers of mental retention, all forms of supernormal knowledge, all forms of mastery, and all the qualities of the buddhas such as the retention of all the teachings of sameness, and so forth, manifest.

original: ye shes chen po la brten pas ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so sor yang dag par rig pa bzhi la sogs pa ma 'dres pa'i chos brgya brgyad cu dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos thams cad dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos thams cad mngon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ye shes chen po la brten pas ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so sor yang dag par rig pa bzhi la sogs pa ma 'dres pa'i chos brgya brgyad cu dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos thams cad dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos thams cad mngon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Based on the great wisdom, the one hundred and eighty unique qualities of the buddhas such as the ten powers and the four forms of fearlessness, all the marvelous qualities, and all the inconceivable qualities manifest.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che las brten nas rin po che rnam pa sna tshogs tshad med grangs med pa thams cad snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che las brten nas rin po che rnam pa sna tshogs tshad med grangs med pa thams cad snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, based on the wish-fulfilling precious jewel, all the various kinds of precious things appear without limit or number.

original: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin chen po'i rin po che dang / ye shes chen po'i rin po che la brten nas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dam pa'i chos rnam pa sna tshogs grangs med tshad med pa mngon du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin chen po'i rin po che dang / ye shes chen po'i rin po che la brten nas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dam pa'i chos rnam pa sna tshogs grangs med tshad med pa mngon du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, based on the precious jewel of great samādhi and the precious jewel of great wisdom, the various kinds of sublime Dharma of all buddhas appear without limit or number.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de ltar na chos kyi sku dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / ye shes ni mtshan ma thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa /
analyzed: de ltar na chos kyi sku dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / ye shes ni mtshan ma thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa /
translated: in this way, the dharmakāya, samādhi, and wisdom are beyond all characteristics.

original: mtshan mas mi gos pa /
analyzed: mtshan mas mi gos pa /
translated: They are not sullied by characteristics.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa /🔽rtag pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa / rtag pa'ang ma yin /
translated: They are nonconceptual.

original: chad pa'ang ma yin pa ste de ni dbu ma'i lam sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chad pa'ang ma yin pa ste de ni dbu ma'i lam sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are neither eternal nor annihilated. This is called the practice of the middle way.

original: rnam par rtog pa yod par snang yang ngo bo nyid la ni rnam par rtog pa'ang med /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yod par snang yang ngo bo nyid la ni rnam par rtog pa'ang med /
translated: Although conceptual thoughts appear to exist, in their essence they are nonconceptual.

original: gsum du bgrang ba'ang yod mod kyi /
analyzed: gsum du bgrang ba'ang yod mod kyi /
translated: There are also those who count three,

original: dngos po gsum @242b du'ang med do //
analyzed: dngos po gsum @242b du'ang med do //
translated: but there are not even three entities.

original: 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa med pa de ni rmi lam dang / sgyu ma lta bu ste gzung ba'ang med 'dzin pa'ang med do //
analyzed: 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa med pa de ni rmi lam dang / sgyu ma lta bu ste gzung ba'ang med 'dzin pa'ang med do //
translated: That which is neither increased nor decreased is like a dream and an illusion, without grasping and without fixation.
