original: chos kyi ngo bo'i de bzhin nyid ni rnam par grol ba'i gnas te 'chi bdag gi spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa /
analyzed: chos kyi ngo bo'i de bzhin nyid ni rnam par grol ba'i gnas te 'chi bdag gi spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa /
translated: The suchness of the essence of phenomena is the abode of liberation, completely transcending the domain of the Lord of Death.

original: 'khor ba'i mun pa las mngon du rgal ba /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mun pa las mngon du rgal ba /
translated: It is the manifest transcendence of the darkness of saṃsāra.

original: skye bo thams cad kyis bsgrub par mi nus pa /
analyzed: skye bo thams cad kyis bsgrub par mi nus pa /
translated: It cannot be accomplished by any being.

original: mthar phyin par mi nus pa /
analyzed: mthar phyin par mi nus pa /
translated: It cannot be accomplished to the end.

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis bzhugs par bya ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis bzhugs par bya ba'i gnas so //
translated: It is the abode to be occupied by all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: dper na / gang la la zhig gser 'dod de gnas kun tu btsal ba las gser gyi sbram bu rnyed nas sbram bu de zhib tu btags te snying po bzhu zhing sbyangs nas rnam par byang bar gyur pa dang / gser de gdu bu la sogs pa rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs yid bzhin du bsgyur te spyad kyang gser gyi rang bzhin nyid ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / gang la la zhig gser 'dod de gnas kun tu btsal ba las gser gyi sbram bu rnyed nas sbram bu de zhib tu btags te snying po bzhu zhing sbyangs nas rnam par byang bar gyur pa dang / gser de gdu bu la sogs pa rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs yid bzhin du bsgyur te spyad kyang gser gyi rang bzhin nyid ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is like a man who, in search of gold, finds a nugget of it in a mountain stream. He breaks the nugget open, melts it down, and refines it. When it is completely pure, he can make of it whatever ornaments he wishes, such as bracelets, earrings, necklaces, or golden crowns.🔽“

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family,

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu'am /🔽rigs kyi bu mo gang 'jig rten gyi dge ba spyod par mos pa des de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu'am / rigs kyi bu mo gang 'jig rten gyi dge ba spyod par mos pa des de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: if a son or daughter of good family

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor de dag mthong ste nye bar bsnyen nas de la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor de dag mthong ste nye bar bsnyen nas de la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: wishes to practice the worldly good, he or she should see the Tathāgata or the retinue of the Tathāgata, approach them, and say the following:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ‘Bhagavān,

original: dge ba ni gang /
analyzed: dge ba ni gang /
translated: what is good?

original: mi dge ba ni gang /
analyzed: mi dge ba ni gang /
translated: What is not good?

original: yang dag pa'i bsgrub pa gang bgyis pas rnam par dag pa'i spyod pa thob par 'gyur /🔽sangs rgyas @243a *//
analyzed: yang dag pa'i bsgrub pa gang bgyis pas rnam par dag pa'i spyod pa thob par 'gyur /🔽sangs rgyas @243a *//
translated: What is the right practice by which one attains pure conduct?

original: bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / de'i 'khor dag gis 'di skad ces 'dri ba la 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / de'i 'khor dag gis 'di skad ces 'dri ba la 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: The Blessed Ones and their retinues think this about the questioner:

original: rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo 'di dag ni dam pa'i chos nyan par mos pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo 'di dag ni dam pa'i chos nyan par mos pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'dod pa ste /
translated: “These sons and daughters of good family are interested in listening to the holy Dharma and in purification.

original: 'di dag la yang dag pa'i chos bstan te snyam mo //
analyzed: 'di dag la yang dag pa'i chos bstan te snyam mo //
translated: I will teach them the true Dharma.”

original: de thos nas kyang tshul bzhin yid la bya ste nan tan gyis bsam pa skyes shing brtson par gyur pa'i mthus /
analyzed: de thos nas kyang tshul bzhin yid la bya ste nan tan gyis bsam pa skyes shing brtson par gyur pa'i mthus /
translated: Having heard it, they will properly pay attention to it, and through the power of the arising of earnest practice and reflection,

original: le lo'i sgrib pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos thams cad bsal te /
analyzed: le lo'i sgrib pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos thams cad bsal te /
translated: they will clear away the obscurations of laziness and all sinful, nonvirtuous things.

original: bslab pa'i gnas thams cad la rab tu gus par gnas shing sems bying ba dang / rgod pa bsal te sa dang po la 'jug go //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gnas thams cad la rab tu gus par gnas shing sems bying ba dang / rgod pa bsal te sa dang po la 'jug go //
translated: They will abide in respect for all the points of training, and having cleared away mental sinking and excitement, they will enter the first ground.

original: sa dang po'i sems la brten nas sems can mang po'i don la brtson pa'i sgrib pa spangs pas sa gnyis pa la 'jug go /
analyzed: sa dang po'i sems la brten nas sems can mang po'i don la brtson pa'i sgrib pa spangs pas sa gnyis pa la 'jug go /
translated: In dependence on the mind of the first ground, they will abandon the obscurations to striving for the welfare of many sentient beings, and they will enter the second ground.

original: sa de las nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs nas sa gsum pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: sa de las nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs nas sa gsum pa la 'jug go //
translated: Having abandoned the obscurations of afflictions on this ground, one enters the third ground.

original: sa de las sems rnam par sbyong ba la sgrib pa spangs nas sa bzhi pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: sa de las sems rnam par sbyong ba la sgrib pa spangs nas sa bzhi pa la 'jug go //
translated: Having abandoned the obscurations to purifying the mind on this ground, one enters the fourth ground.

original: sa de las thabs mkhas pa'i sgrib pa spangs nas sa lnga pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: sa de las thabs mkhas pa'i sgrib pa spangs nas sa lnga pa la 'jug go //
translated: Having abandoned the obscurations to skillful means on this ground, one enters the fifth ground.

original: sa de las don dam pa dang / kun rdzob du dmigs pa'i sgrib pa spangs nas sa drug pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: sa de las don dam pa dang / kun rdzob du dmigs pa'i sgrib pa spangs nas sa drug pa la 'jug go //
translated: Having abandoned the obscurations to observing the ultimate and the conventional on this ground, one enters the sixth ground.

original: sa de las mtshan ma dang / spyod pa la dmigs pa'i sgrib pa spangs nas sa bdun pa la 'jug go /
analyzed: sa de las mtshan ma dang / spyod pa la dmigs pa'i sgrib pa spangs nas sa bdun pa la 'jug go /
translated: Having abandoned the obscurations to observing signs and conduct on this ground, one enters the seventh ground.

original: @243b sa de las mtshan mo 'gog par yang mi dmigs pa'i sgrib pa spangs nas sa brgyad pa la 'jug go /
analyzed: @243b sa de las mtshan mo 'gog par yang mi dmigs pa'i sgrib pa spangs nas sa brgyad pa la 'jug go /
translated: Having abandoned the obscurations to observing the cessation of signs on this ground, one enters the eighth ground.

original: sa de las mtshan mang  skye bar mi dmigs pa'i sgrib pa spangs nas sa dgu pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: sa de las mtshan mang  skye bar mi dmigs pa'i sgrib pa spangs nas sa dgu pa la 'jug go //
translated: Having abandoned the obscurations to observing the non-arising of signs on this ground, one enters the ninth ground.

original: sa de las drug pa mngon par shes pa'i sgrib pa spangs nas sa bcu pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: sa de las drug pa mngon par shes pa'i sgrib pa spangs nas sa bcu pa la 'jug go //
translated: Having abandoned the obscurations to the higher perceptions on this ground, one enters the tenth ground.

original: sa de las shes bya'i sgrib pa dang / kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa spangs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la 'jug go /
analyzed: sa de las shes bya'i sgrib pa dang / kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa spangs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la 'jug go /
translated: Having abandoned the obscurations to be abandoned and the ālaya consciousness, one enters the ground of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa ni rnam par dag pa gsum gyi phyir rab tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa ni rnam par dag pa gsum gyi phyir rab tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The ground of the Tathāgata is called “utterly pure” because of its three purities.

original: gsum gang zhe na; 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na; 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the three?🔽They are the purity of afflictions, the purity of suffering, and the purity of signs. Just as when fine gold is melted, refined, and purified, it is not sullied by dust and dirt, and its natural purity appears. The pure substance of gold does not disappear.

original: nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pa dang / sdug bsngal rnam par dag pa dang / mtshan ma rnam par dag pa ste ji ltar gser bzang po bzhu zhing btul te sbyangs pa la rdul dang / dri mas phyir mi gos shing rang bzhin rnam par dag pa'i gser nyid du snang ste gser gyi dngos po rnam par dag pa'ang med par gyur pa ma yin pa bzhin no; ;dper na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pa dang / sdug bsngal rnam par dag pa dang / mtshan ma rnam par dag pa ste ji ltar gser bzang po bzhu zhing btul te sbyangs pa la rdul dang / dri mas phyir mi gos shing rang bzhin rnam par dag pa'i gser nyid du snang ste gser gyi dngos po rnam par dag pa'ang med par gyur pa ma yin pa bzhin no; ;dper na /
translated: For example,

original: chu rnyog pa can dvangs te rnam par dvangs nas chu'i rang bzhin nyid gsal bar gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: chu rnyog pa can dvangs te rnam par dvangs nas chu'i rang bzhin nyid gsal bar gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: when turbid water is cleared and becomes transparent, the nature of the water becomes clear.

original: chu de nyid med par gyur pa'ang ma yin no //🔽de bzhin du chos kyi sku'ang nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal sna tshogs 'dus pa spangs nas bag chags ma lus par bsal te sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa nyid snang @244a *//
analyzed: chu de nyid med par gyur pa'ang ma yin no // de bzhin du chos kyi sku'ang nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal sna tshogs 'dus pa spangs nas bag chags ma lus par bsal te sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa nyid snang @244a *//
translated: The water itself does not cease to exist.

original: bar gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bar gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: In the same way, the dharmakāya is the pure essence of buddhahood, which appears after the afflictions and various sufferings have been eliminated and all habitual tendencies have been completely purified.

original: dngos po med par gyur pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med par gyur pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the dharmakāya ceases to exist.

original: yang dper na /
analyzed: yang dper na /
translated: It is like this:

original: nam mkha' la du ba dang / sprin dang / rdul dang / na bun gyis bsgribs pa de med par gyur na nam mkha'i khams de rnam par dag par gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: nam mkha' la du ba dang / sprin dang / rdul dang / na bun gyis bsgribs pa de med par gyur na nam mkha'i khams de rnam par dag par gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: When the space element is free from the obscurations of smoke, mist, dust, and fog, it is said to be pure.

original: nam mkha' de nyid med par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' de nyid med par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the space element ceases to exist.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi sku nyon mongs pa thams cad zad pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa zhes bya yi /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi sku nyon mongs pa thams cad zad pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa zhes bya yi /
translated: In the same way, the dharmakāya is said to be pure because all the afflictions have been exhausted.

original: sku de nyid med par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sku de nyid med par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the dharmakāya ceases to exist.

original: gzhan yang / dper na /
analyzed: gzhan yang / dper na /
translated: It is like this:

original: 'ga' zhig gnyid log pa'i rmi lam na chu chen pos khyer nas /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gnyid log pa'i rmi lam na chu chen pos khyer nas /
translated: Some, while asleep, dream that they are carried away by a great river.

original: lus dang / rkang lag bskyod de lus dang / sems 'bad pa dang bcas pas pha rol gyi 'gram du phyin pa rmi'o //
analyzed: lus dang / rkang lag bskyod de lus dang / sems 'bad pa dang bcas pas pha rol gyi 'gram du phyin pa rmi'o //
translated: They move their body and limbs, and with their body and mind exerting themselves, they reach the other side.

original: rmi lam de las sad pa dang / chu dang / phan tshun gyi 'gram tha dad pa yod pa mthong ba med kyang /
analyzed: rmi lam de las sad pa dang / chu dang / phan tshun gyi 'gram tha dad pa yod pa mthong ba med kyang /
translated: When they awaken from that dream, they do not see the river or the two banks.

original: sems nyid med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems nyid med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that the mind itself does not exist.

original: 'khor bar rnam par rtog pa zad pa'ang blo rnam par dag pa ste sangs rgyas pa de med pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khor bar rnam par rtog pa zad pa'ang blo rnam par dag pa ste sangs rgyas pa de med pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, the exhaustion of conceptual thoughts in saṃsāra is the purification of the mind, and the attainment of buddhahood is not nonexistence.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings la rnam par rtog pa thams cad mi skye ba'i phyir rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang dag pa'i sku ni med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings la rnam par rtog pa thams cad mi skye ba'i phyir rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang dag pa'i sku ni med pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the dharmadhātu is called pure because all conceptual thoughts do not arise, and the true body of the buddhas is not nonexistent.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Moreover, son of noble family,

original: chos kyi sku ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag par longs spyod rdzogs pa'i @244b sku snang bar 'gyur ro //🔽las kyi sgrib pa rnam par dag pas sprul pa'i sku snang par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag par longs spyod rdzogs pa'i @244b sku snang bar 'gyur ro // las kyi sgrib pa rnam par dag pas sprul pa'i sku snang par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Dharma Body is the appearance of the Enjoyment Body, which is the purification of the afflictive obstructions.🔽The Emanation Body is the appearance of the purification of the obstructions to omniscience.

original: ye shes kyi sgrib pa rnam par dag pas chos kyi sku snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sgrib pa rnam par dag pas chos kyi sku snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The Dharma Body is the appearance of the purification of the obstructions to omniscience.

original: dper na nam mkha' stong pa la brten nas glog 'byung /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' stong pa la brten nas glog 'byung /
translated: For example, based on empty space, lightning appears.

original: glog la brten te 'od snang ngo //
analyzed: glog la brten te 'od snang ngo //
translated: Based on lightning, light appears.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi sku la brten te longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur snang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi sku la brten te longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur snang ngo //
translated: In the same way, based on the Dharma Body, the Enjoyment Body appears.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la brten te sprul pa'i sku snang ngo //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la brten te sprul pa'i sku snang ngo //
translated: Based on the Enjoyment Body, the Emanation Body appears.

original: de la rang bzhin rnam par dag pa'i phyir chos kyi skur snang ngo //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin rnam par dag pa'i phyir chos kyi skur snang ngo //
translated: There, the Dharma Body appears because of the natural purity.

original: ye shes rnam par dag pas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur snang ngo //
analyzed: ye shes rnam par dag pas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur snang ngo //
translated: The Enjoyment Body appears because of the purity of wisdom.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnam par dag pas sprul pa'i skur snang ngo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnam par dag pas sprul pa'i skur snang ngo //
translated: The Emanation Body appears because of the purity of meditative stabilization.

original: de gsum rnam par dag pa ni chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / ro gcig pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par grol ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / mtha' klas pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas thams cad ni sku tha mi dad do //
analyzed: de gsum rnam par dag pa ni chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / ro gcig pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par grol ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / mtha' klas pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas thams cad ni sku tha mi dad do //
translated: The purity of these three is the suchness of phenomena, the suchness of non-differentiation, the suchness of one taste, the suchness of complete liberation, and the suchness of the infinite. Therefore, all buddhas are not different in body.

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag gi ston pa chen po'o zhes smra zhing mos pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gnyis su med par bsam pa thag pa nas shes pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag gi ston pa chen po'o zhes smra zhing mos pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gnyis su med par bsam pa thag pa nas shes pa yin no //
translated: if a son or daughter of noble family says, “The Tathāgata is my great teacher,” and has conviction in that, then they know the non-duality of the Tathāgata’s body from the depths of their mind.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de'i phyir spyod yul thams cad la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtog pa yongs su bsal bas chos de dag la mtshan nyid gnyis su med pa dang / @245a *//
analyzed: de'i phyir spyod yul thams cad la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtog pa yongs su bsal bas chos de dag la mtshan nyid gnyis su med pa dang / @245a *//
translated: therefore, in all spheres of experience, by dispelling false conceptualization, those phenomena are without the duality of characteristics, and

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / 'phags pa rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba de la ji lta ji ltar gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis yang dag par bsgrubs pas de lta de ltar sgrib pa thams cad sbyong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / 'phags pa rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba de la ji lta ji ltar gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis yang dag par bsgrubs pas de lta de ltar sgrib pa thams cad sbyong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And the accomplishment of the noble ones, to the extent that they are accomplished in the manner of non-duality, to that extent all obscurations are purified.

original: ji tsam du sgrib pa byang bar gyur pa de tsam du chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes rnam par dag pa mchog thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji tsam du sgrib pa byang bar gyur pa de tsam du chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes rnam par dag pa mchog thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: To the extent that the obscurations are purified, to that extent the purity of the suchness of phenomena and the wisdom of suchness are attained.

original: ji tsam du chos kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa de bzhin du dbang phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyang 'dzin cing yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji tsam du chos kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa de bzhin du dbang phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyang 'dzin cing yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: To the extent that the dharmadhatu, suchness, and perfect wisdom are pure, to that extent all perfect powers are also held and perfected.

original: sgrib pa thams cad kyang sbyong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad kyang sbyong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And all obscurations are purified.

original: sgrib pa thams cad rnam par dag pa'i phyir de ni yang dag pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / bden pa'i mtshan nyid du mthong ba de ni yang dag pa zhes bya /
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad rnam par dag pa'i phyir de ni yang dag pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / bden pa'i mtshan nyid du mthong ba de ni yang dag pa zhes bya /
translated: Because all obscurations are purified, it is the real, the suchness, the true wisdom, and the characteristic of the truth.

original: 'phags pa'i gzigs pa zhes bya /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gzigs pa zhes bya /
translated: That is called the vision of the noble ones.

original: yang dag pa bden pa'i tshul du sangs rgyas mthong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa bden pa'i tshul du sangs rgyas mthong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the vision of the buddhas in the manner of the true reality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshul bzhin du chos nyid mthong ba'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon du gzigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du chos nyid mthong ba'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon du gzigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they see reality in the correct way, the buddhas also call it the vision of all tathāgatas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas ni khams gsum las mngon par 'byung zhing yang dag pa'i @245b mtha' la gzhol bas 'phags pa'i gang zag de lta bus mthong bar mi nus so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas ni khams gsum las mngon par 'byung zhing yang dag pa'i @245b mtha' la gzhol bas 'phags pa'i gang zag de lta bus mthong bar mi nus so //
translated: Because the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, who are intent on the limit of reality, do not have the ability to see it, since they have not transcended the three realms.

original: de ma mthong bas byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni thams cad kyang phyin ci log gis bslad pa dang / log /
analyzed: de ma mthong bas byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni thams cad kyang phyin ci log gis bslad pa dang / log /
translated: Since they do not see it, all ordinary beings are affected by error and

original: pa'i rnam par rtog pas shes par mi nus te /
analyzed: pa'i rnam par rtog pas shes par mi nus te /
translated: cannot understand it with their misconceptions.

original: dper na / shin tu mthu chung ba'i ri bong gi rkyal gyis rgya mtsho mi rgal ba bzhin du byis pa so so'i skye bo'i shes pas chos kyi de bzhin nyid mngon par shes par mi nus so //
analyzed: dper na / shin tu mthu chung ba'i ri bong gi rkyal gyis rgya mtsho mi rgal ba bzhin du byis pa so so'i skye bo'i shes pas chos kyi de bzhin nyid mngon par shes par mi nus so //
translated: For example, just as the ocean cannot be crossed by the leap of a very weak rabbit, the suchness of phenomena cannot be understood by the consciousness of ordinary beings.

original: 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par rtog pa med bar chos thams cad la dbang chen po brnyes pa /
analyzed: 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par rtog pa med bar chos thams cad la dbang chen po brnyes pa /
translated: However, it is the domain of the Tathāgatas, who have attained great power over all phenomena without conceptualization,

original: rnam par dag pa'i ye shes zab mo dang ldan pa rnams kyi rang gi spyod yul yin te /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i ye shes zab mo dang ldan pa rnams kyi rang gi spyod yul yin te /
translated: and who possess profound, pure wisdom.

original: gzhan dang thun mong du ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dang thun mong du ma gyur pa'o //
translated: It is not shared in common with others.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bskal pa tshad med grangs med par sku dang srog mi phangs par dka' ba spyod pas shin tu mchog dam pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bskal pa tshad med grangs med par sku dang srog mi phangs par dka' ba spyod pas shin tu mchog dam pa /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān Buddhas, through difficult conduct in which they do not spare their bodies and lives for immeasurable, countless eons, are the most supreme.

original: bla na med pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa /
translated: unsurpassed,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
translated: inconceivable,

original: tshig dang / brjod pa'i spyod yul las 'das pa /
analyzed: tshig dang / brjod pa'i spyod yul las 'das pa /
translated: beyond the scope of words and expressions,

original: shin tu zhi ba /
analyzed: shin tu zhi ba /
translated: utterly peaceful,

original: 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i sku de brnyes par gyur to //
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i sku de brnyes par gyur to //
translated: and free from all fear.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de lta bu'i chos kyi chos nyid shes shing mthong ba ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba med par yun ring du 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos kyi chos nyid shes shing mthong ba ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba med par yun ring du 'tsho ba'o //
translated: knowing and seeing the true nature of phenomena in this way is to live for a long time without birth, old age, sickness, or death.

original: gnyid kyis log pa dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa med par sems rtag par ting nge 'dzin du gnas te g-yo zhing spros pa med pa'o //🔽gang zhig de bzhin gshegs @246a *//
analyzed: gnyid kyis log pa dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa med par sems rtag par ting nge 'dzin du gnas te g-yo zhing spros pa med pa'o // gang zhig de bzhin gshegs @246a *//
translated: Without sleep, hunger, or thirst, the mind always abides in samādhi, without wavering or elaboration.

original: pa la spros pa dang bcas pa'i sems bskyed na des ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa la spros pa dang bcas pa'i sems bskyed na des ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Anyone who arouses a conceptual state of mind in relation to the Thus-Gone One will not see the Thus-Gone One.

original: gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bshad pa 'di ni phan pa dang bcas pa ste sus mdo 'di thos pa des gcan gzan dang / yi dvags ma rungs pa dang / skye bo mi bgrungs pa rnams dang yang phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bshad pa 'di ni phan pa dang bcas pa ste sus mdo 'di thos pa des gcan gzan dang / yi dvags ma rungs pa dang / skye bo mi bgrungs pa rnams dang yang phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Whoever hears this discourse will not encounter any wild beasts, evil spirits, or wicked people.

original: chos 'di thos pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'ang zad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos 'di thos pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'ang zad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The ripening of the fruit of hearing this Dharma will never be exhausted.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni lung du mi ston pa dang / yul thams cad la mkhyen par bzhed pa'i dgongs pa mi mnga'/
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni lung du mi ston pa dang / yul thams cad la mkhyen par bzhed pa'i dgongs pa mi mnga'/
translated: The Tathāgatas do not have the intention to make predictions or to know all objects.

original: 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la dgongs pa tha dad pa mi mnga' 'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la dgongs pa tha dad pa mi mnga' 'o //
translated: They do not have a different intention regarding saṃsāra and nirvāṇa.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ma brtags pa'i lung ston pa mi mnga' 'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ma brtags pa'i lung ston pa mi mnga' 'o //
translated: The Tathāgatas do not make predictions without examination.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni spyod lam rnam pa bzhir ye shes kyis ma bzung ba med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni spyod lam rnam pa bzhir ye shes kyis ma bzung ba med do //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas do not have any deportment that is not embraced by wisdom.

original: chos thams cad la thugs rjes ma zin pa med do //
analyzed: chos thams cad la thugs rjes ma zin pa med do //
translated: They do not have any Dharma that is not embraced by compassion.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde bas ma bzung ba med do //🔽rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde bas ma bzung ba med do // rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: There is no sentient being who is not embraced by his benefit and happiness.

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las gser 'od dam pa'i mdo sde 'di thos te mos na de sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags dang / lha ma yin gyi gnas su nam yang mi ltung ngo //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las gser 'od dam pa'i mdo sde 'di thos te mos na de sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags dang / lha ma yin gyi gnas su nam yang mi ltung ngo //
translated: If a son or daughter of a noble family hears this Sutra of Golden Light and believes in it, they will never fall into the realms of hell-beings, animals, hungry ghosts, or asuras.

original: rtag tu lha dang / mi'i gnas su skye ste dman par mi skye ba dang / rtag tu sangs @246b rgyas bcom ldan 'das la bsnyen bkur byed cing /
analyzed: rtag tu lha dang / mi'i gnas su skye ste dman par mi skye ba dang / rtag tu sangs @246b rgyas bcom ldan 'das la bsnyen bkur byed cing /
translated: They will always be reborn in the realms of gods and humans, never in inferior states, and will always serve and attend to the blessed buddhas.

original: dam pa'i chos nyan cing 'dzin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa dag tu skye bar yang 'gyur te de ni chos shin tu zab mo 'di thos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nyan cing 'dzin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa dag tu skye bar yang 'gyur te de ni chos shin tu zab mo 'di thos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They will listen to and uphold the sublime Dharma, and will be reborn in the pure buddha-fields. This is because they have heard this extremely profound Dharma.

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: If a son or daughter of a noble family

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par yang mkhyen cing lung yang ston to //🔽gang rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par yang mkhyen cing lung yang ston to // gang rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: The Tathagata knows that those sons and daughters of good family will not turn back from supreme and perfect enlightenment, and he also predicts it.

original: rigs kyi bu mo la las shin tu zab mo dam pa'i chos 'di rna lam du lan cig thos na yang de ni de bzhin gshegs pa la dbang za bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo la las shin tu zab mo dam pa'i chos 'di rna lam du lan cig thos na yang de ni de bzhin gshegs pa la dbang za bar mi 'gyur /
translated: If a son or daughter of good family hears this most profound Dharma even once, then he or she will not despise the Tathagata,

original: dam pa'i chos la mi dmod /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos la mi dmod /
translated: will not revile the holy Dharma,

original: 'phags pa rnams la mi brnyas /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la mi brnyas /
translated: will not disparage the noble Sangha,

original: skye dgu thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba ma skyes pa ni skyes par byed /
analyzed: skye dgu thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba ma skyes pa ni skyes par byed /
translated: will cause the roots of virtue of all beings that have not yet arisen to arise,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba skyes pa rnams ni 'phel ba dang / yongs su smin par byed cing /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba skyes pa rnams ni 'phel ba dang / yongs su smin par byed cing /
translated: will cause the roots of virtue of those that have arisen to increase and mature,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can ji snyed pa de dag pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa stobs par byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can ji snyed pa de dag pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa stobs par byed do //
translated: and will cause all beings in the world to practice the perfections.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha'i snying po dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / rgyal po chen po bzhi la sogs pa'i lha rnams stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas te thal mo sbyar ba btud nas shin tu gus pa dang bcas pas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la sbyi bos phyag btsal nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha'i snying po dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / rgyal po chen po bzhi la sogs pa'i lha rnams stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas te thal mo sbyar ba btud nas shin tu gus pa dang bcas pas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la sbyi bos phyag btsal nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di
translated: Then the bodhisattva Ākāśagarbha, Śakra, Brahmā, the four great kings, and so on, rose from their seats, put their upper robes over one shoulder, bowed with palms together, and with great respect touched their heads to the Bhagavān’s feet.🔽

original: skad ces gsol to //🔽gser 'od dam pa mdo @247a *//
analyzed: skad ces gsol to // gser 'od dam pa mdo @247a *//
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Ākāśagarbha, Śakra, Brahmā, the Four Great Kings, and so on, the gods, rose from their seats, put their upper robes over one shoulder, bowed with palms together, and with great respect touched their heads to the Bhagavān’s feet. They said this to the Bhagavān:

original: sde'i dbang po'i rgyal po 'di 'chad pa'i gnas de dang / yul de dag tu phan pa'i yon tan 'di bzhi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sde'i dbang po'i rgyal po 'di 'chad pa'i gnas de dang / yul de dag tu phan pa'i yon tan 'di bzhi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Bhagavān, in the places and regions where this king of sūtras, the Sūtra of Golden Light, is taught, these four benefits will arise.

original: bzhi gang zhe na yul der rgyal po pha rol po'i dgra dang / dpung dar ba yis mi tshugs pa dang / nad thams cad bsal cing tshe ring ba dang / bkra shis shing bde bas yang dag pa'i chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na yul der rgyal po pha rol po'i dgra dang / dpung dar ba yis mi tshugs pa dang / nad thams cad bsal cing tshe ring ba dang / bkra shis shing bde bas yang dag pa'i chos ston par byed do //
translated: What are the four? The kings of those places will not be harmed by enemies from other countries or by the rise of rival armies; all diseases will be removed and life will be long; and with auspicious happiness, they will teach the true Dharma.”

original: btsun mo dang / slas dang / sras dang / sras mo dang / blon po rnams kyang 'dum zhing rtsod pa med pa dang / gcam bu dang / sgyus 'tsho ba spangs pa'i rgyal pos gnang zhing bkur bar 'gyur ba dang / dge sbyong dang /
analyzed: btsun mo dang / slas dang / sras dang / sras mo dang / blon po rnams kyang 'dum zhing rtsod pa med pa dang / gcam bu dang / sgyus 'tsho ba spangs pa'i rgyal pos gnang zhing bkur bar 'gyur ba dang / dge sbyong dang /
translated: The queen, the harem, the princes, the princesses, and the ministers are in harmony and do not quarrel. The king is honored and respected for abandoning flattery and hypocrisy.

original: bram ze la sogs pa dam pa'i chos spyod cing nad med pa dang / bde bas glo bur du 'chi ba med pa dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs thams cad sgrub cing yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gang dus thams cad du 'byung ba chen po bzhi mi 'phrod pa med pa dang /
analyzed: bram ze la sogs pa dam pa'i chos spyod cing nad med pa dang / bde bas glo bur du 'chi ba med pa dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs thams cad sgrub cing yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gang dus thams cad du 'byung ba chen po bzhi mi 'phrod pa med pa dang /
translated: The ascetics, the brahmins, and so forth, who practice the holy Dharma, are free from illness and are happy. They do not die suddenly. They accomplish and maintain all the accumulations of merit. They are never incompatible with the four great elements.

original: rtag par lha rnams kyis srung zhing skyob pa dang / byams pa dang / snying rje mnyam pas gnod pa med pa dang / 'tshe ba'i sems med pa dang / sems can rnams dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro zhing byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa sgrub par smon lam 'debs so //
analyzed: rtag par lha rnams kyis srung zhing skyob pa dang / byams pa dang / snying rje mnyam pas gnod pa med pa dang / 'tshe ba'i sems med pa dang / sems can rnams dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro zhing byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa sgrub par smon lam 'debs so //
translated: They will always be protected and guarded by the gods, and they will be without harm, with equal love and compassion, without a harmful mind, and they will make aspirations for sentient beings to go for refuge to the Three Jewels and accomplish the conduct of the bodhisattvas.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bdag cag kyang rtag tu mdo sde 'di rgyas par bgyi ba'i slad du mdo sde 'di su 'dzin pa'i @247b gang zag de'i gnas su mchi zhing phan gdags par bgyi'o zhes gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis legs so zhes bka' stsal te /
analyzed: bdag cag kyang rtag tu mdo sde 'di rgyas par bgyi ba'i slad du mdo sde 'di su 'dzin pa'i @247b gang zag de'i gnas su mchi zhing phan gdags par bgyi'o zhes gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis legs so zhes bka' stsal te /
translated: we too will always go to the place of that person who upholds this sutra in order to benefit them and spread this sutra. The Blessed One said, Excellent!

original: legs so // legs so //
analyzed: legs so // legs so //
translated: Excellent!

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de ltar de bzhin du khyed kyis kyang mdo sde'i rgyal po dam pa 'di 'jig rten na yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir spel ba dang / rgyas par bya ba la brtson par gyis shig /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin du khyed kyis kyang mdo sde'i rgyal po dam pa 'di 'jig rten na yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir spel ba dang / rgyas par bya ba la brtson par gyis shig /
translated: in that way, you too should strive to spread and propagate this excellent king of sutras in the world in order to make it endure for a long time.

original: gser 'od dam pa mdo sde'i dbang po'i rgyal po las /
analyzed: gser 'od dam pa mdo sde'i dbang po'i rgyal po las /
translated: From the King of Glorious Sutras, the Sublime Golden Light,

original: sku gsum rnam par dbye ba'i le'u ste gsum pa'o ////
analyzed: sku gsum rnam par dbye ba'i le'u ste gsum pa'o ////
translated: the third chapter, on the analysis of the three bodies.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' mdzes pa'i tog gnyid log pa'i rmi lam na gser gyi rnga kun tu snang ba /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' mdzes pa'i tog gnyid log pa'i rmi lam na gser gyi rnga kun tu snang ba /
translated: Then, in the dream of the sleeping bodhisattva Beautiful Crest, he saw a golden drum that was all-illuminating,

original: dper na / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'dra ba zhig mthong ngo //
analyzed: dper na / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'dra ba zhig mthong ngo //
translated: like the orb of the sun.

original: phyogs thams cad na'ang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das grangs med dpag tu med pa dag rin po che'i shing drung na rin po che'i bee d'urya'i khri rnams la bzhugs shing 'khor brgya stong du mas yongs su bskor te mdun gyis bltas nas chos ston pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: phyogs thams cad na'ang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das grangs med dpag tu med pa dag rin po che'i shing drung na rin po che'i bee d'urya'i khri rnams la bzhugs shing 'khor brgya stong du mas yongs su bskor te mdun gyis bltas nas chos ston pa mthong ngo //
